question: [File: serai/crypto/frost/src/nonce.rs] [Cross-function] [Serialization Round-trip - High] Does deserializing serialized commitments produce identical binding factors and nonces?

[File: serai/crypto/frost/src/nonce.rs] [Struct: GeneratorCommitments] [PartialEq Implementation - Medium] Does the derived PartialEq properly compare curve points, or could equivalent points with different encodings be seen as unequal?
[File: serai/crypto/frost/src/nonce.rs] [Struct: GeneratorCommitments] [Copy Semantics - Medium] Is Copy appropriate for curve points, or could this lead to unintended side effects?
[File: serai/crypto/frost/src/nonce.rs] [Struct: NonceCommitments] [Clone Cost - Low] Is cloning NonceCommitments expensive due to Vec<GeneratorCommitments>, potentially causing DoS?
[File: serai/crypto/frost/src/nonce.rs] [Struct: Commitments] [Clone Cost - Low] Does cloning Commitments clone potentially large nested vectors, creating memory exhaustion risk?
[File: serai/crypto/frost/src/nonce.rs] [Struct: IndividualBinding] [Option State - High] Is the Option<Vec<C::F>> binding_factors properly managed to prevent use-after-none?
[File: serai/crypto/frost/src/nonce.rs] [Struct: BindingFactor] [HashMap Security - Medium] Could hash collisions in the HashMap cause participant commitments to be overwritten?
[File: serai/crypto/frost/src/nonce.rs] [Transcript Integration] [Domain Separation - Critical] Are all transcript domain separators unique across the entire FROST protocol?
[File: serai/crypto/frost/src/nonce.rs] [Transcript Integration] [Commitment Binding - Critical] Does the transcript properly bind nonce commitments to prevent commitment substitution attacks?
[File: serai/crypto/frost/src/nonce.rs] [Transcript Integration] [Challenge Derivation - High] Is the binding factor challenge derivation using transcript.challenge(b'rho') correctly implemented?
[File: serai/crypto/frost/src/nonce.rs] [Cryptographic] [Binomial Nonce Structure - Critical] Does the nonce structure r = d + be match the FROST paper specification exactly?
[File: serai/crypto/frost/src/nonce.rs] [Cryptographic] [Commitment Scheme - Critical] Are commitments to nonces hiding and binding as required for FROST security?
[File: serai/crypto/frost/src/nonce.rs] [Cryptographic] [Binding Factor Computation - Critical] Does the binding factor computation prevent Wagner's attack on multi-party Schnorr signatures?
[File: serai/crypto/frost/src/nonce.rs] [Cryptographic] [Nonce Aggregation - Critical] Is the aggregated nonce R = sum(Di) + sum(Ei * œÅi) computed correctly for all participants?
[File: serai/crypto/frost/src/nonce.rs] [Memory Safety] [Zeroization Coverage - High] Are all secret nonce values properly zeroized on drop, including in error paths?
[File: serai/crypto/frost/src/nonce.rs] [Memory Safety] [Zeroizing Wrapper - High] Does Zeroizing<C::F> properly zeroize even when the field element is moved or copied?
[File: serai/crypto/frost/src/nonce.rs] [Memory Safety] [Clone Zeroization - High] When Nonce is cloned, are both the original and clone properly zeroized independently?
[File: serai/crypto/frost/src/nonce.rs] [Memory Safety] [Vector Zeroization - Medium] Are vectors containing Nonces properly zeroized when dropped?
[File: serai/crypto/frost/src/nonce.rs] [Side Channel] [Constant Time - High] Do scalar multiplications in NonceCommitments::new execute in constant time to prevent timing attacks?
[File: serai/crypto/frost/src/nonce.rs] [Side Channel] [Multiexp Timing - High] Does multiexp_vartime in BindingFactor::nonces leak information through timing?
[File: serai/crypto/frost/src/nonce.rs] [Side Channel] [Branch Timing - Medium] Could conditional branches in commitment calculations leak information about nonce values?
[File: serai/crypto/frost/src/nonce.rs] [Side Channel] [Memory Access Patterns - Medium] Do variable-length loops reveal information about the number of generators or nonces?
[File: serai/crypto/frost/src/nonce.rs] [Error Handling] [Panic Paths - High] Are there any panic paths that could be triggered by malicious input to cause DoS?
[File: serai/crypto/frost/src/nonce.rs] [Error Handling] [Unwrap Usage - High] Do unwrap() calls in binding_factors() and nonces() create exploitable panic paths?
[File: serai/crypto/frost/src/nonce.rs] [Error Handling] [Index Panics - High] Could out-of-bounds indexing in HashMap or Vec cause validator consensus failures?
